purpose: To provide a powerful and flexible 3D game engine for developers, enabling the creation of high-quality games with a Unity-like experience.
principle: Built using C# and leveraging graphics APIs like DirectX, OpenGL, Metal, and Vulkan for rendering, with a focus on providing a Unity-inspired development environment.
reusability: Designed to be modular and extensible, allowing developers to integrate custom modules and plugins. The MIT license facilitates wide adoption and modification.
limitations: As an alpha-stage project, it may lack comprehensive documentation and stability, with potential performance and feature limitations compared to mature engines like Unity.
name: Prowl
description: An Open Source C# 3D Game Engine under MIT license, inspired by Unity and featuring a complete editor
highlight: An open-source 3D game engine inspired by Unity, featuring a comprehensive editor and cross-platform graphics support.
